@ewencp I've added a LogRateLimiter utility with the method I would need as a wrapper. I think it's probably useful to have it for other scenarios so I kept it in commons/util, but if that doesn't make sense please let me know. I also hardcoded 1000 messages as the number we'll skip since I don't see a reason to make it configurable, but it might make sense to alert the user that the log message has been suppressed, what do you think?

Merged to trunk, thanks!

I have a meta question for this PR and https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1446:

In #1446, we are adding three `sensor` APIs to the StreamsMetrics as well, and I'm wondering how that will be aligned with this PR that expose the inner general `Metrics` directly? I feel that we should choose to do either one of the two options:

1. Do not expose a general API in `StreamsMetrics` like the one exposed in #1446, and just expose the one in this PR to return the inner `? extends Metrics` to let users do whatever they want.
2. Expose the `sensor` API as proposed in #1446, which is an indirect way of adding any type of sensors (note that `StreamsMetrics` is accessible from `ProcessorContext`), with a bit of principles for specifying `scopeName`, `entityName`, and `operationName` etc, and how that will be translated to the logic of adding sensors to the inner metrics.

If we do both of these two set of APIs, it is quite confusing from a user's perspective.
@junrao @ijuma @guozhangwang  Can you please review and merge?

Test PASSed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.10).
@ijuma  added a test case for this PR. Please have a review. Thanks.
@junrao Could you help address the comments above for this PR? Seems it's been a quite while since the last response. Thank you!
@hachikuji Any chances to address the comments these days? Please review the pull request. Thank you!
@hachikuji That makes sense. I'll just merge the fix to 0.10.1 then.

@junrao I explained a little on why a unit test was not included in the PR description. The main reason is the difficulty of testing log cleaner in 0.10.1 branch before the log cleaner refactoring. Given no one is going to develop further on 0.10.1 branch and we have added unit test to trunk. I am thinking It might be OK to just pick the fix without a unit test. What do you think?

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.12/93/
Test FAILed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

@junrao Thanks for the reviews. I did some testing this evening. I thought I was seeing some performance difference initially in the producer, but it seems within the variance of the test runs. If I were guessing from the results, I'd say the non-compressed path is a tad slower while the compressed path might be a tad faster, but don't put much weight behind either conclusion. In any case, the results seem close enough that I'd recommend merging now. Note that I did add one commit to address a couple minor cleanups and tighten up the iteration code a little.
